Text: Carl I was recently informed via Janet Bowers at NNG that there have been some issues with regard to the gas contract to serve the Pleasant Valley Peaker In order to have someone address your issues I have passed on your concerns to Darron Giron who works MidMarket and Origination on the Central Gas Desk Darrons number is I have also made the VP of the Central Gas Desk aware of your concerns You should be getting a call from Darron in the next couple of days after he has had a chance to get up to speed on the transaction I am now doing long term power marketing in the ECAR region and thought it was best to let the gas desk address this however please feel free to contact me should the situation warrant Thanks Oscar Dalton Enron Power Marketing

Re AEC Agreement Cc The environmental clearance referenced is actually a clearnace from the RUS to make sure that AEC has abided by the National Environmental Policy Act NEPA The RUS enforces NEPA for Coops while FERC enforces NEPA for regulated utilities The NEPA clearance which is issued by the RUS is a standard procedure inherent in any development of this type AEC is constructing their new plant at an existing power plant site that is already permitted and been in operation for many years thus this is a positive for the clearnace I would expect the clearance to be granted by the RUS given AECs past postive development work and relationship with the RUS as well as the fact that they are developing at an existing site
Re FGTEnron side letter agreementDo we need to reference the payment for the meter in this document since there will be no tax grossup paid

Alabama Electric Cc Electric confirmed on Monday that they will not trigger their termination right under our recent Agreement Pursuant to our executed transaction with AEC dated AEC had the right to terminate the Agreement by providing ENA with notice by if AEC had not received environmental clearance from the Rural Utility Services AEC has indicated that while they have not received final clearances from the RUS they are comfortable going at risk under the ENA Agreement The Agreement is selfimplementing in that AEC elected to not give notice AEC expects to have their final clearance by mid January This transaction can now be booked as a Q transaction Thanks to everyone for assistance on this transaction Oscar Dalton
Aec Documentis the document for Alabama Electric Cooperative I would like to discuss with you to begin the drafting of the Letter of Understanding thanks Oscar

AEC Cc the bullit sheet for AEC as well as a revised deal diagram Please reference as you prepare the Letter Agreement We need to send the initial draft to AEC by noon Monday Again I appreciate your hard work on this matter Please call David or myself on this matter If you need me over the weekend my pager is Thanks Oscar

AEC Reimbursement AgreementsHere are the electronic reimubrsement agreements All that would be changed are the names Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on AM Enron Capital Trade Resources Corp From Steve Morse PM To Oscar CT cc Subject AEC Reimbursement Agreements As requested S

AEC Agrm Cc the latest version of AEC Please note the major changes in Paragraph Dan please make sure the changes I have made are written in an acceptable legal format Also I have made Paragraph bilateral let me know your comments ASAP as I need to get this to AEC early Wednesday morning Also we will need to incorporate the appropriate changes into the ECTCitrus Agreement
Central Iowa Conference Callis to confirm our conference call with CIPCO at pm on Monday at pm the confernce room is thanks Oscar
are some phone notes from a discussion today with CIPCO We have a conference call scheduled Monday May th at pm and I need both of you in it

wpsOn the Wisconsin Public Service deal WPS please consider the following One LM to be sited near Green Bay Wisconsin Will be configured in combined cycle mode with a HRSG of the output will go to an industrial customer of WPS Key Questions What is the heat rate and Mw rating of our turbine at site conditions degrees winter and degrees summer What is the water consumption with Sprint verses water injection What is a year fixed gas price at chicago starting on a baseload volume of mmbtud

Central Iowa Coop Update Cc with CIPCO today on our proposal submitted on and they are initially interested in what we put together ie GEEAs with right to substitute technology as long as overall project economics are not impacted They will be meeting with their consultants tomorrow to come up with a list of questions to help develop a short list Assuming we make it to a short list then we will be asked to come to Iowa to meet with their generation planning team All of this should play out over the next weeks Also please note that we are looking at this as a way to substitute LMs for the two EAs and keep the heat rate spread A plant at CIPCO also is an OPPD workout We have a site under option in Iowa that is into MidAm Kv and AlliantCIPCO Oscar
nan
initial comments on the cipco rfp
Dairyland Proposalis another good format for cipco Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on AM Russ NRON AM To Oscar CT cc Subject Dairyland Proposal
nan

cipcoMy thoughts on the Central Iowa Power Cooperative RFP Let me know what you think We will develop two GE EAs Unit operational Unit operational We will use the OgdenBoone County Site being secured by John Moore The site is mile from Northern Natural Gas Mainline Also Ameren Kv and Alliant Kv line onsite Assume interconnects to both of these systems Please break out cost for each Assume no fuel oil backup Assume no black start Design the units to be later converted to combined cycle Assume water injection for nox control Assume portable demin water facilities Assume Enron does EPC Assume CIPCO will finance and own the plant through ther term of the PSA and thereafter Assume CIPCO will execute a power sales agreement PSA with Enron from through

CIPCOare the responses to my CIPCO questions Henwood Energy is a third party evaluation consultant They will review the RFP responses Burns McDonald has assisted in site selectionreview and will participate in evaluation of any selfbuilds that CIPCO does CIPCO has a preference to purchase from the market or from plants that Enron would develop They are not big on wanting to build their own plant or JV CIPCO has identified a key site in Iowa that has direct access to their own system as well as the MidAm system They would make that site available to us if we needed it They will not reveal the site unless we get into negotiations CIPCO will consider terms longer than years They would consider a year term if there was a capital project involved CIPCO does have their own transmission system as well as pointpoint transmission agreements on MidAm and Alliant The point to point agreement are from plants where CIPCO owns a partial share to CIPCOs system CIPCO appeared to not value the LM technology to any higher degree than other machines CIPCO was not sure of how things would be financed If CIPCO decided to self build they would certainly be interested in working with Enron on the gas deal

CIPCO RFP DATED reviewing the CIPCO RFP Enron has questions that we would like to have answered I will call you on Friday to followup on these Who is Henwood Energy Services and what aspect of the RFP will they review What role will Burns McDonnell play in the RFP and subsequent project Enron controls several development sites in Iowa that provide direct access into Alliant Does CIPCOs transmission arrangements with Alliant allow for a network service whereby energy injected anywhere into the Alliant Grid in Iowa can be returned to CIPCO under the present transmission arrangement Enron also controls sites on MidAm in Iowa Does CIPCO have network rights on MidAm or direct ties with MidAm Would generation on the MidAm system be of value to CIPCO CIPCO states they will consider proposals beyond the timeframe How many years would CIPCO consider under a transaction where new generation is being built in a jointly developed project CIPCO states they have reviewed several sites for generation development Can CIPCO provide Enron with a list of preferred sites Does CIPCO own separate transmission facilities or is the CIPCO system assumed to be CIPCOs network transmission contract on the Alliant System Would CIPCO consider a project utilizing the General Electric LM technology as we described in our previous meeting in November On a new capital project would CIPCO finance the project with RUS financing internal sources or be interested in financing through Enron If Enron is not successful in the RFP and CIPCO elects to build a new plant would CIPCO work with Enron to structure a delivered gas supply transaction whereby Enron would provide a new connecting gas lateral gas transportation service and physical gas supply I would appreciate you insights on the above Thanks Oscar Dalton

Rochester Mn LM Deal Cc informed today by Rochester that they will not be working with Enron or General Electric on the LM Project The following are key points Based on a GE evaluation of the site the total net output of a new LM with Sprint Package is Mw at average site conditions degrees Rochester had initially thought they would need Mw and Enron could remarket the balance until Rochesters load growth utilized the balance Rochester had initially considered an LM Mw and was not in favor of a larger machine becasue they thought the incremental megawatts would cost in the MM to MM range Enrons proposal absorbed Rochesters risk of the incremental megawatts and Rochester was very interested in our concept Subsequent to our discussions with Rochester and providing a couple of proposals the formal bidding process on the turbines indicated that the cost of the incremental Megawatts above their Mw requirement was only approximately MM In fact the cost of the last Mw was only MM Rochester choose to utilize the Pratt Whitney FT Twin Pak turbine This machine yields Mw net at site conditions and the extra Mw over the Mw provided by the LM was only an incremental MM Rochester says the cost of the Mw will be approximately MM or Kw Installation cost would be additional Note ENAs bid for the LM at Mw was MM and GE was at MM Rochesters board instructed them not to enter into any long term arrangments where they would have to sign long term PPAs etc Rochester will look to have the PW turbine installed and will market the additional Megawatts on a day to day and month to month basis Thanks to everyone for their efforts on this prospect Please pass the above information on to anyone who would benefit from this technical and competitive feedback Oscar

Rochester Cc with Rochester this morning and they advised that they will present a recommendation to their Board on as to the party they will negotiate with At this point they are evaluating the bids and will be issuing questions etc Note parties were disqualified for failure to submit bid bonds Again even though we were low bidder I would not view this as a given that we will be the final party Ill stay close to this and keep everyone advised

GT Bid matrix Cc ENA was low bidder for the LM deal with Rochester I will be calling Rochester today to determine next actions steps Please note that our proposal is contingent upon a bundled deal I would not take this as an indication of a done deal ie No Green Sheet Yet Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on AM Walter Schlink on AM To Oscar CT cc Subject GT Bid matrix Attached is the preliminary bid results from the bid opening on Friday March These do not include any information except for the bid summary information and should not be used to presume any status or evaluation of any of the bid packages Bid Matrixxls Bid Matrixxls

draft of RPU Let me know if this is ok If we get the PPA value today we will include RPU tells us that the only thing that will be made public is the MM turbine pricing RPU will provide us with a list of all bidders and their pricing

Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on PM Oscar Dalton PM To Stuart CT cc Subject here is my first cut at Rochester Please add the nonbinding language you want Remember the RFP is only focused on the turbine We have previously advised Rochester that we cannot sell a turbine without bundling with other services

rochester Cc with Wally Schlink of Rochester today in follow up to our ccall He thought the call went well however he still fees the main point is the price for the PPA RPU will be meeting with their Financial Advisor on Monday and they plan to then meet internally and figure what they would want from Enron to do the deal I believe the will give us their number next week and we will know where to head from there In the interim we need to be working on the following Response to the RFP in their format Prepare a bid bond and get an understanding as to what it may bind us to do I would like for Russ to take lead on these matters Note that we cannot go forward with Rochester unless we are technically in the process Oscar

RPUEnron Conference Callare questions we need to be prepared to answer for our conference call tomorrow with Rochester We will be in A lets meet at am Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on PM Walter Schlink on PM To Oscar CT cc Larry Koshire Walt Lorber Subject RPUEnron Conference Call Oscar Attached is a list of preliminary questions based on the proposal of Feb th We will be in Larry Koshires office for the call at am Central Time His number is We need to also conference in Kiah Harris of Burns McDonnell His number is Call with any questions or if clarifications are needed Wally questions to Enron on proposaldot questions to Enron on proposaldot

Rochester Cc interested in our proposal As such they want to do a conference call and meeting as follows Conference call on Thursday at am their general manager will be involved Depending on the conference call Rochester will want us to come up for another face to face meeting on Tuesday Some of Rochesters key questions are as follows Whats our PPA value I asked them to name it and they said they would want enough to cove their debt serviceAlso they said they are fair and they are not greedy Rochester wants to verify scope Are we offering turnkey I told them yesthey want to discuss details Where did we price the electric interconnect To the busbar or to inlet of step up transformer Rochester has the ability to individually negotiate with us as long as we respond to their bid on time and provide a bid bond If we do not respond then they have to get city council approval to negotiate directly Basically we need to complete some of the bid form to get us in the door Bids are open on ACTION ITEMS Russ Ben Oscar and Ozzie to participate in conference call on Russ Ben and Ozzie to go to Rochester if warranted I am unable to travel during that week Determine if other Enron participants need to be involved Mike Nanney etcMike went on the first site visit with me Respond to Rochester in bid format and look into getting a bid bond Russ Ben and Oscar work together to come up with a PPA value Verify whether we want a second merchant unit at the site SUMMARY Rocheste seems to be very open and agreeable to doing business with Enron I feel we need to push this one

Lincoln Cc a conference call with Lincoln today and they advised they are no longer interested in working with Enron on the LM opportunity that had been under consideration The main reasons given was that there was extreme existance in the organization Lincoln said they would need an annual payment of to per kwyr to do the deal which they feel is extremely out of the market and Enron would not transact At this level we would be breakeven at best even with the OPPD workout value and the gas deal Lincoln is currently developing a peaking project using ABB units that must be in operation All of their resources are dedicated to this project Their plan is to install LMs for a start date and they are not prepared to deal with an acceleration of the project The feel that working with Enron at this time only complicates their workload Lincoln did say they were interested in working with us on a gas supply and pipeline transaction as the site for development is miles from Northern Natural Gas I will begin this evaluation and consider the possibility of selling two LMs bundled with the supply and infrastructure deal Oscar

Re Questions Cc Here is Lincolns response to our questions You may want to get with Sandra to discuss this Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on AM Rich Kosch on AM To Oscar CT cc Subject Re Questions Assume an cost of moneytaxable and year amortizaton schedule per our Financial people Assume also that we will need to include a bond reserve fund of equal to one years P and I plus about financing costs The latter two simulates the cost of taxexempt financing requirements which we are assuming taxable will be in the same ballpark of requirements Again the does not include an SCR When we got our PSD permit for our Rokeby unit the informal quotes we got for that unit were in the to Million dollar range In the end we proved to EPA that the addition was not cost effective by some convoluted economic analysis they made us go thru However it became very obvious to us this is their next regulatory objective We were so convinced that our Rokeby was going to need an SCR we had internally resigned ourselves to that unpleasant assumption We would assume a mw units cost would be about the cost of this larger unit MW machine ie Rokeby Oscar Dalton on PM To Rich ES cc Subject Questions Rich In working through our analysis for the revised proposal to Lincoln I had the following questions In Lincolns cost estimate of kw did this include SCRs Under taxable financing what interest rate and repayment period would Lincoln normally find acceptable Any input you could provide would be appreciated Thanks Oscar

Re Questionsdo not include SCRs on Lincoln Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on AM Rich Kosch on AM To Oscar CT cc Subject Re Questions Oscarthe does not include an SCR I will need to check on the financial interest and length of time Oscar Dalton on PM To Rich ES cc Subject Questions Rich In working through our analysis for the revised proposal to Lincoln I had the following questions In Lincolns cost estimate of kw did this include SCRs Under taxable financing what interest rate and repayment period would Lincoln normally find acceptable Any input you could provide would be appreciated Thanks Oscar

Conference Room for Weds Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on PM Yvonne Marr ENRON PM To Oscar CT cc Subject Conference Room for Weds Oscar I found two separate conference rooms for tomorrow Wednesday for your meetings They are am to pm Conference Room C pm to pm Conference Room C Please let me know if you need help with anything else ym

LM dealsis to verify our meetings tomorrow on the following Lincoln Electric RussBen am to noon conference room tba Rochester Mn RussBen same as above Madision WI ErinMathew pm to pm conference room tba For each opportunity I would like to line out a deal structure and formulate a base case and subsets for modeling I am totally open to ideas and input I would also like to take our concepts and review with Geoff Allen MAPP Mid Marketer tomorrow afternoon as a cursory review If there are questionaires input forms etc that are required for modeling efforts we want to make sure we cover that as well In addition we may want to have credit begin a review to verify the parties are creditworthy I know that Lincoln and Madision are highly rated but I am not sure about Rochester Due to the short fuse on each of these we need to be prepared to turn proposals around in to business days Thanks Oscar

rochester Cc with Wally Schlink of Rochester today in follow up to our ccall He thought the call went well however he still fees the main point is the price for the PPA RPU will be meeting with their Financial Advisor on Monday and they plan to then meet internally and figure what they would want from Enron to do the deal I believe the will give us their number next week and we will know where to head from there In the interim we need to be working on the following Response to the RFP in their format Prepare a bid bond and get an understanding as to what it may bind us to do I would like for Russ to take lead on these matters Note that we cannot go forward with Rochester unless we are technically in the process Oscar

Rochester Cc with Rochester this morning and they advised that they will present a recommendation to their Board on as to the party they will negotiate with At this point they are evaluating the bids and will be issuing questions etc Note parties were disqualified for failure to submit bid bonds Again even though we were low bidder I would not view this as a given that we will be the final party Ill stay close to this and keep everyone advised

Rochester Mn LM Deal Cc informed today by Rochester that they will not be working with Enron or General Electric on the LM Project The following are key points Based on a GE evaluation of the site the total net output of a new LM with Sprint Package is Mw at average site conditions degrees Rochester had initially thought they would need Mw and Enron could remarket the balance until Rochesters load growth utilized the balance Rochester had initially considered an LM Mw and was not in favor of a larger machine becasue they thought the incremental megawatts would cost in the MM to MM range Enrons proposal absorbed Rochesters risk of the incremental megawatts and Rochester was very interested in our concept Subsequent to our discussions with Rochester and providing a couple of proposals the formal bidding process on the turbines indicated that the cost of the incremental Megawatts above their Mw requirement was only approximately MM In fact the cost of the last Mw was only MM Rochester choose to utilize the Pratt Whitney FT Twin Pak turbine This machine yields Mw net at site conditions and the extra Mw over the Mw provided by the LM was only an incremental MM Rochester says the cost of the Mw will be approximately MM or Kw Installation cost would be additional Note ENAs bid for the LM at Mw was MM and GE was at MM Rochesters board instructed them not to enter into any long term arrangments where they would have to sign long term PPAs etc Rochester will look to have the PW turbine installed and will market the additional Megawatts on a day to day and month to month basis Thanks to everyone for their efforts on this prospect Please pass the above information on to anyone who would benefit from this technical and competitive feedback Oscar

CIPCO RFP DATED reviewing the CIPCO RFP Enron has questions that we would like to have answered I will call you on Friday to followup on these Who is Henwood Energy Services and what aspect of the RFP will they review What role will Burns McDonnell play in the RFP and subsequent project Enron controls several development sites in Iowa that provide direct access into Alliant Does CIPCOs transmission arrangements with Alliant allow for a network service whereby energy injected anywhere into the Alliant Grid in Iowa can be returned to CIPCO under the present transmission arrangement Enron also controls sites on MidAm in Iowa Does CIPCO have network rights on MidAm or direct ties with MidAm Would generation on the MidAm system be of value to CIPCO CIPCO states they will consider proposals beyond the timeframe How many years would CIPCO consider under a transaction where new generation is being built in a jointly developed project CIPCO states they have reviewed several sites for generation development Can CIPCO provide Enron with a list of preferred sites Does CIPCO own separate transmission facilities or is the CIPCO system assumed to be CIPCOs network transmission contract on the Alliant System Would CIPCO consider a project utilizing the General Electric LM technology as we described in our previous meeting in November On a new capital project would CIPCO finance the project with RUS financing internal sources or be interested in financing through Enron If Enron is not successful in the RFP and CIPCO elects to build a new plant would CIPCO work with Enron to structure a delivered gas supply transaction whereby Enron would provide a new connecting gas lateral gas transportation service and physical gas supply I would appreciate you insights on the above Thanks Oscar Dalton

CIPCOare the responses to my CIPCO questions Henwood Energy is a third party evaluation consultant They will review the RFP responses Burns McDonald has assisted in site selectionreview and will participate in evaluation of any selfbuilds that CIPCO does CIPCO has a preference to purchase from the market or from plants that Enron would develop They are not big on wanting to build their own plant or JV CIPCO has identified a key site in Iowa that has direct access to their own system as well as the MidAm system They would make that site available to us if we needed it They will not reveal the site unless we get into negotiations CIPCO will consider terms longer than years They would consider a year term if there was a capital project involved CIPCO does have their own transmission system as well as pointpoint transmission agreements on MidAm and Alliant The point to point agreement are from plants where CIPCO owns a partial share to CIPCOs system CIPCO appeared to not value the LM technology to any higher degree than other machines CIPCO was not sure of how things would be financed If CIPCO decided to self build they would certainly be interested in working with Enron on the gas deal

cipcoMy thoughts on the Central Iowa Power Cooperative RFP Let me know what you think We will develop two GE EAs Unit operational Unit operational We will use the OgdenBoone County Site being secured by John Moore The site is mile from Northern Natural Gas Mainline Also Ameren Kv and Alliant Kv line onsite Assume interconnects to both of these systems Please break out cost for each Assume no fuel oil backup Assume no black start Design the units to be later converted to combined cycle Assume water injection for nox control Assume portable demin water facilities Assume Enron does EPC Assume CIPCO will finance and own the plant through ther term of the PSA and thereafter Assume CIPCO will execute a power sales agreement PSA with Enron from through

Central Iowa Coop Update Cc with CIPCO today on our proposal submitted on and they are initially interested in what we put together ie GEEAs with right to substitute technology as long as overall project economics are not impacted They will be meeting with their consultants tomorrow to come up with a list of questions to help develop a short list Assuming we make it to a short list then we will be asked to come to Iowa to meet with their generation planning team All of this should play out over the next weeks Also please note that we are looking at this as a way to substitute LMs for the two EAs and keep the heat rate spread A plant at CIPCO also is an OPPD workout We have a site under option in Iowa that is into MidAm Kv and AlliantCIPCO Oscar

Re Questionsdo not include SCRs on Lincoln Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on AM Rich Kosch on AM To Oscar CT cc Subject Re Questions Oscarthe does not include an SCR I will need to check on the financial interest and length of time Oscar Dalton on PM To Rich ES cc Subject Questions Rich In working through our analysis for the revised proposal to Lincoln I had the following questions In Lincolns cost estimate of kw did this include SCRs Under taxable financing what interest rate and repayment period would Lincoln normally find acceptable Any input you could provide would be appreciated Thanks Oscar

Re Questions Cc Here is Lincolns response to our questions You may want to get with Sandra to discuss this Forwarded by Oscar DaltonHOUECT on AM Rich Kosch on AM To Oscar CT cc Subject Re Questions Assume an cost of moneytaxable and year amortizaton schedule per our Financial people Assume also that we will need to include a bond reserve fund of equal to one years P and I plus about financing costs The latter two simulates the cost of taxexempt financing requirements which we are assuming taxable will be in the same ballpark of requirements Again the does not include an SCR When we got our PSD permit for our Rokeby unit the informal quotes we got for that unit were in the to Million dollar range In the end we proved to EPA that the addition was not cost effective by some convoluted economic analysis they made us go thru However it became very obvious to us this is their next regulatory objective We were so convinced that our Rokeby was going to need an SCR we had internally resigned ourselves to that unpleasant assumption We would assume a mw units cost would be about the cost of this larger unit MW machine ie Rokeby Oscar Dalton on PM To Rich ES cc Subject Questions Rich In working through our analysis for the revised proposal to Lincoln I had the following questions In Lincolns cost estimate of kw did this include SCRs Under taxable financing what interest rate and repayment period would Lincoln normally find acceptable Any input you could provide would be appreciated Thanks Oscar

FW Network Resource Requirements Cc The following is an email I recieved from Wabash with regard to them looking at risk associated with a Into product and their concern over the RTO forcing the designation of firm point resources I thought you would like to see this in conjunction with our last conversation thanks Oscar Original Message From Allen McKee VPAcomENRON Sent Thursday April PM To Dalton III Oscar Cc Rick Coons Kari Wetter Fred Kunkel Subject Network Resource Requirements Mr Dalton As we have discussed the control area operators we coordinate with in the NIPSCo AEP IPL and Cinergy areas are increasingly concerned about the reliability of transmission and its dependence on expected power flows from source to sink Much of this concern comes from incremental reliability requirements being developed by ECAR and NERC along with potentially substantial fines for failure to comply In order for Wabash Valley to obtain Network Transmission service we must have firm resources that can be qualified as designated network resources We received a document from a controlarea operator that defines their criteria for network resources These criteria are defined as follows Network resources do not include any generation that is committed for sale to another party on a firm basis For a power purchase to qualify as a network resource it must be available to the purchaser on a noninterruptible basis Power purchases that can be interrupted by the seller for reliability reasons qualify as network resources This includes power sales that are provided with a curtailment priority below that of the sellers native load Purchased power that can be interrupted by the seller for economic reasons does not qualify as a network resource but purchases that can be interrupted for extreme economic penalties other than more economic sale or purchase opportunities qualify as network resources For a power purchase to qualify as a network resource the purchaser must have an obligation to take the power The obligation to purchase does not need to be in the form of a capacity payment However if there is no capacity payment the contract should include a minimum take obligation The Commission does not require an aroundtheclock purchase obligation it has approved as a network resource a power purchase with a minimum capacity factor of during onpeak hours and no minimum take in offpeak hours How much lower a capacity factor the Commission would permit is not clear The requirement that a network resource be noninterruptible applies to the transmission service as well as the power supply itself Therefore a network customer that designates an offsystem resource as a network resource must obtain firm transmission service for the generator to the system of the network transmission provider If transmission from the generator to the network transmission provider is nonfirm transmission service the power purchase does not qualify as a network resource However the requirement of firm transmission service does not apply to any generator that was serving the load on July because such generation is grandfathered by Order No It may be that your organization can meet these criteria with documentation of resources and transmission path agreements so as to not require any additional firmness of the power supply you have already proposed to us Please take a look and contact me with any further information you can provide Let me know also if you need any else from me Allen McKee System Planning Principal Wabash Valley Power Association

Alcoa Cc In a conference call today with Alcoa on the Services business we are pursuing the following issues with regard to credit were mentioned Alcoa has revoked a MM credit line they had open with Enron Alcoa was uncomfortable taking on more Enron exposure given the recent press In addition to the powergas exposure there is metals exposure Future deals will need to be closely reviewed by Alcoas credit group By copy of this email I am requesting that Ed Sacks contact Mike Fry of Alcoas credit group in Atlanta Please advise if you need his phone number Also we want to move ahead with getting the EEI in place as Alcoas represents one of our strongest prospects for the new Services business We will need to get Alcoa comfortable with our credit issues In addition we are talking to Alcoa on various other pieces of business at their various smelters in PJM and TVA as well as rainfall hedges for their hydro operations Oscar Dalton
